intro: Macrosolen krempfii, commonly known as the golden star hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers with a distinctive star-shaped pattern. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a velvety texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight.
